organic_results.title: The validity of children's reports of their parents' educational level: A methodological note
organic_results.snippet: The accuracy of sixth grade pupils' reports of their parents' educational attainment is tested through cross tabulations of the questionnaire replies of children and interviews with their mothers. The high non-response rate, upward bias, and low correlation with more objective measures of SES of children's reports cast doubt on their validity. The tendency for white children to upgrade mothers, black children to upgrade fathers, and children of either sex to upgrade the parent of the same sex as themselves is interpreted as due to the influence of …
